Dear Sally Jo Mouw:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
7/17/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12205 Required staff
• (4) An agency shall appoint a social service
supervisor who possesses the qualifications in
either of the following:
• (b) A bachelor's degree from an accredited
college or university in a human behavioral
science, or in another major where 25% of
the course credits earned toward the
degree are in human behavioral sciences,
and 4 years of experience as a social
service worker, 2 years of which are in an
agency or in a child caring institution, or in
an agency in a child welfare function.
One of One file of staff employed by the agency less than one year contained
documentation (resume) indicating the agency social supervisor does not have any
of the required experience as a social service worker.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption application
and prior to approving a family for adoption.
2

One of Three adoptive family assessment reviewed was not completed within the
required timeframe.
SRM 200 Fingerprint Security
CPAs are permitted to document the State of Michigan
complies with the Adam Walsh Child Protection and
Safety Act of 2006 P.L.109-248, Title I, Subtitle C, Sec.
151 or 24 USC 20961. If the applicant has no criminal
history, this shall be the statement documented in the
narrative assessment.
Note: It is a violation of CJIS Security Policy to document
language that says a determination was based on
national fingerprint-based criminal history.
If the applicant has a criminal history, the CPA is
permitted to use the fingerprint-based criminal history
response as a tool to collect public documents, court
orders, and police reports to assess the individual's
criminal history. The public documents collected, the
content they contain, and the applicant's self-reported
statements can be documented in the narrative
evaluation released to the respective state.
Two of Three adoptive family assessments reviewed identified the completion of FBI
Fingerprinting within the report.

• Use of the CWL-4607 Chief Administrator Assessment form is required

3

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was reviewed and discussed during the
inspection entrance. The chief administrator reported program development and
recruitment efforts have been the top priority during the review period. The chief
administrator did not identify any non-compliances with the adoptive family
assessments and child placements completed.
The agency has not certified foster homes or placed any youths in foster homes
during the period under review.
Financial Overview
Review of the agency's financial statements and independent auditor's report was
completed. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
The chief administrator, who is also the adoption worker, was interviewed. She
reported being supervised by a part-time supervisor who works remotely. The
chief administrator indicated she meets with her supervisor regularly through video
conferencing, phone calls, and emails.
During the course of the inspection, it was determined the supervisor does not
meet the qualifications; therefore, either a variance will need to be pursued, or a
qualified supervisor will need to be hired before any additional work can be
approved.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency contains sufficient space and equipment to perform the functions of
foster care, adoption and foster home certification services. Physical CHRI and
case records are stored securely within separate drawers in a locked cabinet.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
